article_title: The Year Noah Syndergaard Learned to Pitch
article_text:
SALT LAKE CITY—Noah Syndergaard doesn't deserve to pitch for the Mets. Not yet, anyway. He understands that now. A 5.74 ERA in Triple-A would humble anyone.

It took a little time and a lot of growing up for Syndergaard to arrive at that conclusion. He reported to his first major-league training camp in February brimming with confidence, hoping that his final journey to New York involved little more than a pit stop in Las Vegas. After...

og.title: The Year Noah Syndergaard Learned to Pitch

article_metadata.author: Jared Diamond
article_metadata.article.origheadline: The Year Noah Syndergaard Learned to Pitch

article_summary:
SALT LAKE CITY—Noah Syndergaard doesn't deserve to pitch for the Mets.
It took a little time and a lot of growing up for Syndergaard to arrive at that conclusion.
He reported to his first major-league training camp in February brimming with confidence, hoping that his final journey to New York involved little more than a pit stop in Las Vegas.
A 5.74 ERA in Triple-A would humble anyone.
He understands that now.
